alert.note: Alert for Maricopa; Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued September 01 at 8:51PM MST until September 01 at 9:45PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... Pinal County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 945 PM MST. * At 851 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from San Tan Mountain Park to near San Tan Valley to near Magma, moving southwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Less than one half mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 175 and 189. AZ Route 87 between mile markers 134 and 167. AZ Route 202 between mile markers 40 and 49. Locations impacted include... Mesa, Chandler, Gilbert, Florence, Coolidge, Sun Lakes, Queen Creek, Blackwater, Chandler Heights, Tumbleweed Park, Chandler City Hall, Magma, San Tan Village Mall, San Tan Valley and Seville. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE! Strong to severe thunderstorms are also possible behind this wall of dust. Keep updated with this quickly evolving situation.
